org.cdnomlqko.jglutil.shader

Class Shader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cdnomlqko.jglutil.shader.Shader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComputeShader, VFShader

    public class Shader
extends java.lang.Object
    Compiles, links, provides uniform and SSBO support for shader orpgrams. For now, it can work with vertex shaders, fragment shaders and compute shaders.
    Author:
    CDnoMlqko

        protected Shader(int file_count)
        Prepares the shader to work with file_count shader files.
        Parameters:
        file_count - - how many shader source files will be used in the shader.

    • Method Detail

      • finishProgramCreation

        protected void finishProgramCreation()
        Attaches, links the shader programs, then checks for errors, then creates the Uniforms and SSBOs the parser has found in the source code.

      • setSourceFiles

        protected void setSourceFiles(java.lang.String... source_files)
        Sets the shader's source files to the provided file names later to be compiled and used.
        Parameters:
        source_files -

      • attachShaders

        private void attachShaders()
        Attaches all the shader programs.

      • createShader

        protected void createShader(int type,
                            int target)
        Creates a shader program.
        Parameters:
        type - accepts GL_VERTEX_SHADER, GL_FRAGMENT_SHADER, GL_COMPUTE_SHADER
        target - - which source file to use. This is the index of the file name, provided to setSourceFiles(String...).

      • checkLinkStatus

        private void checkLinkStatus()
        Checks the shader for linking errors.

      • checkValidateStatus

        private void checkValidateStatus()
        Checks the shader for validation errors.

      • checkCompileStatus

        private void checkCompileStatus(int target)
        Checks the specified shader program for compilation errors.
        Parameters:
        target - - the shader program. This is the index of the surce file name, provided to setSourceFiles(String...)

      • createUniform

        protected void createUniform(java.lang.String uniformName)
        Creates an uniform variable with the specified name if it exists in the GLSL shader code.
        Parameters:
        uniformName - - the name of the uniform variable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the uniform is not used or does not exist in the GLSL shader, an Exception is thrown.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:

        public void setUniform(java.lang.String uniformName,
                       int value)
        Sets the specified uniform variable.
        Parameters:
        uniformName - - name of an already created uniform variable.
        value - - the value for the uniform variable to be set to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - just as getUniformLocation(String)

      • createSSBO

        public void createSSBO(java.lang.String name,
                       int binding)
        Creates a SSBO (Shader Storage Buffer Object) that can be used to pass data to the shader through a FloatBuffer
        Parameters:
        name - - the GLSL buffer where the data from the SSBO will be written
        binding - - where the SSBO will be bound to the shader storage block

      • setSSBO

        public void setSSBO(java.lang.String name,
                    int bufferId)
        Binds the given buffer to the binding point, used by the SSBO with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the SSBO in the shader
        bufferId - - a valid OpenGL buffer pointer to be bound to that SSBO

      • setSSBO

        public static void setSSBO(int bufferId,
                           int binding)
        Binds the given buffer to the given binding point to be used in a SSBO.
        Parameters:
        bufferId - - a valid pointer to a OpenGL buffer
        binding - - the binding point of the SSBO that is to use the buffer

      • createUBO

        public void createUBO(java.lang.String name,
                      int binding)
        Registers that UBO. Then it can be set with setUBO(String, int). Note that setUBO(int, int) can be used even with UBO-s that have not been registered that way.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the SSBO in the Shader source
        binding - - the binding of the buffer object. If it is set with layout(binding = X), this method overwrites that

      • setUBO

        public void setUBO(java.lang.String name,
                   int bufferId)
        Binds the given UBO to use the given buffer. Uses the binding that is given to createUBO(String, int). Note that setUBO(int, int) can be used for UBO-s that have not been registered.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the UBO in the Shader source code
        bufferId - - a valid OpenGL buffer pointer

      • setUBO

        public static void setUBO(int bufferId,
                          int binding)
        Binds the given buffer to the given binding point so it can be used by a UBO, bound on the same binding point
        Parameters:
        bufferId -
        binding -

      • getSSBOBinding

        public int getSSBOBinding(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the SSBO in the Shader source code
        Returns:
        the binding point of the SSBO with the given name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the SSBO has not been registered in this Shader.

      • getUBOBinding

        public int getUBOBinding(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the UBO in the Shader source code
        Returns:
        the binding point of the UBO with the given name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the UBO has not been registered in this Shader.

      • getProgramId

        public int getProgramId()

      • bind

        public void bind()
        The shader will be used after this line till it is either unbound or another. shader is bound.

      • unbind

        public void unbind()
        No shader will be used after this line till a shader is bound.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes the shader. It cannot be used again.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
